image.altText: Child arriving for school

props.synopsis: More schools will reopen in Canberra on Wednesday with a list of current closures to be updated this afternoon.

title.children: 11 schools to remain closed in the ACT as coloured sand clean-up continues

image.altText: A sign for the park has a CSIRO logo above it. It's located among shrubbery and native Australian trees.

props.synopsis: After 440 positions were slashed last year, the CSIRO has announced more staff cuts across the country in a bid to remain financially viable.

title.children: CSIRO to cut up to 350 research jobs in major overhaul

image.altText: ACT Ambulance Service

props.synopsis: An internal review has revealed the service needs at least 80 additional ambulance officers, response times are worsening, and night shifts are failing to meet minimum staffing levels 96 per cent of the time.

title.children: ACT ambulance officer shortages could be 'difference between life and death'

image.altText: ACT Australian of the Year Rose McGready.

props.synopsis: Rose McGready has been living in a refugee camp for more than 30 years, having dedicated her life to saving the lives of vulnerable women and children.

title.children: Dr McGready honoured for 30 years spent working with mums in Myanmar

image.altText: Outside a modern court building.

props.synopsis: In 2022, a woman died after being run over by a ute outside her house. The legal case about exactly what happened and who's responsible is now heading to the High Court.

title.children: Contest over murder, manslaughter or freedom heads to High Court

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: A 30-year-old man is behind bars after prosecutors alleged he pursued a woman into an underground car park where he tried to sexually assault her.

title.children: Canberra man denied bail over alleged car park sexual assault

image.altText: Gloved hands use tweezers to examine pink coloured sand in a zip-lock bag.

props.synopsis: Dozens of schools remain closed in the ACT, Tasmania and South Australia today as the clean-up and disposal of potentially asbestos-laced coloured sand continues. What risk does it actually pose?

title.children: 'Don't panic': Asbestos expert says coloured sand poses 'very low risk'

image.altText: People dressed in white, all-body suits at the entrance to a building.

props.synopsis: The ACT has closed 70 schools over the coloured sand asbestos scare. Why is it the only jurisdiction to do so?

title.children: Why is the ACT the only jurisdiction to close schools over coloured sand?

image.altText: Two fighters in the ring.

props.synopsis: The organiser of this fight club says it saves lives. But critics say it is putting young men at serious risk.

title.children: The fight club concept gaining traction in only unregulated Australian state

image.altText: A man wearing dark sunglasses and a black jacket

props.synopsis: Matthew Gruter spends the night in a detention centre after having his visa revoked for attending a protest organised by the National Socialist Network.

title.children: South African man in immigration detention over neo-Nazi rally

image.altText: An older, grey-haired man in glasses wears a dark suit as he sits in a room.

props.synopsis: A previous disclosure that the head of the federal corruption watchdog had been consulted 11 times has been corrected to 21 following questions from the ABC.

title.children: Defence inspector inadvertently omitted 10 consultations with NACC chief

image.altText: A woman with chin length blonde hair in a navy jacket and white top sits in a green chair at a table and stares ahead.

props.synopsis: Victoria's first female Liberal Party leader is facing a gargantuan task to unite her party and prove the opposition is worth voting for, Richard Willingham writes.

title.children: A 'clown show' or an alternative government — the task facing Jess Wilson

image.altText: A track map showing the path of a tropical low which turns into a category 2 cyclone at 4pm on November 20.

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology has issued its first forecast track map for a tropical low over the NT, showing the system is expected to strengthen into a category two cyclone by Thursday night.

title.children: Category two cyclone predicted off NT coast by Thursday

image.altText: Hannah sitting in the sun smiling with a drink in hand.

props.synopsis: Lachlan Young strangled Ms McGuire in their Sebastopol home, then placed her body in her ute and set it alight in bushland on Ballarat's outskirts, staging the scene to look like a suicide.

title.children: Lachlan Young sentenced to 28 years' jail for murdering Hannah McGuire

image.altText: Five grey-coloured balls washed up on sand one os partially broken and looks black on the inside.

props.synopsis: Sydney water is working to determine the source of high levels of grease and oil that caused debris balls to wash up on beaches across Sydney and the Central Coast.

title.children: Sydney waste water likely origin of mystery balls on Central Coast beaches

image.altText: Eliesa Katoa of Tonga is attended to by a trainer, holding a towel, bleeding an with head injuries

props.synopsis: Melbourne Storm star Eli Katoa will miss the 2026 NRL season as he continues his recovery from head knocks that forced him to have brain surgery.

title.children: Storm star to miss entire NRL season after shocking Test head knocks

image.altText: A young woman cutting a birthday cake

props.synopsis: Rajwinder Singh, who has pleaded not guilty to the murder of 24-year-old Toyah Cordingley, is on trial in the Supreme Court in Cairns.

title.children: Accused murderer 'stressed' on day Toyah Cordingley's body found, court told

image.altText: a small old urn

props.synopsis: Ahead of the 2025/26 Ashes series getting underway on November 21 in Perth, test out your knowledge in our fiendish Ashes quiz.

title.children: Think you know the Ashes? Try our fiendish quiz to find out

image.altText: Man from behind sitting down at the beach staring at the water

props.synopsis: While the childcare crisis has left me concerned about my own child's safety, as a male early childhood educator, I'm also worried about the future of men in the sector, writes Ben.

title.children: I'm a male early childhood educator. I worry about my son in care

image.altText: A large storm cloud over the ocean.

props.synopsis: The fleet of the 1998 Sydney to Hobart yacht race set sail from the harbour city, unaware they were travelling directly into the path of a huge storm and unrelenting swell that would throw the race into disarray and claim six lives.

title.children: How these crew members survived 'violent monster waves' at sea

image.altText: Donald Trump sits at a desk in the Oval Office.

props.synopsis: The bill — to direct the US Justice Department to release its documents about late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein — now looks set to sail through the House of Representatives.

title.children: Trump says he would sign bill to release Epstein files

image.altText: Young girl with red hair smiles

props.synopsis: A 58-year-old man has been charged over the death of a teenage girl, who was just a month away from turning 18 when she was struck in an alleged hit-and-run.

title.children: Man charged as family mourn teenage girl killed in alleged hit-and-run

image.altText: A person holding a smartphone dialling 000

props.synopsis: TPG Telecom says a Sydney customer died after outdated software blocked a Samsung phone from making Triple Zero calls.

title.children: Outdated Samsung software behind failed Triple Zero call death, telco says

image.altText: An image of the UN security council members voting.

props.synopsis: The UN Security Council approves a US plan for Gaza that authorises an international stabilisation force to provide security in the devastated territory.

title.children: UN Security Council backs US plan for Gaza

image.altText: An up close of Mark Speakman.

props.synopsis: The leadership of the NSW Liberals remains in doubt with Mark Speakman's future in a perilous position. It comes as a new leader has been elected for the NSW Nationals.

title.children: NSW Liberal leadership under a cloud as Nats appoint new leader

image.altText: Nine women stand in aprons and hair nets behind a food stall.

props.synopsis: A Vanuatu provincial government says it will repeal parts of its new bylaw banning menstruating women from preparing and selling food at markets and roadside stalls after the decision sparked a public outcry.

title.children: Vanuatu council U-turns on 'absurd' period ban

image.altText: A multi-storey office building behind a fence.

props.synopsis: Legal Aid NT says it will refuse all new criminal clients who are not already in custody, including children as young as 10, due to funding constraints.

title.children: Ten-year-olds facing jail could be forced to go without a lawyer in the NT

image.altText: Uniformed members of the National Guard and agents patrol in front of Memphis' Home of the Blues sign

props.synopsis: A Tennessee judge has blocked the use of the National Guard in Memphis, but also put the order on hold, giving the government five days to appeal.

title.children: National Guard cannot be deployed to Memphis, judge rules

image.altText: Base of Mount Anne, Tasmania, photo by Ben Wilkinson

props.synopsis: Police say the two women were "reasonably prepared" but worsening weather meant they were cold, wet and unable to continue their journey.

title.children: Weather hampers rescue of hikers stranded on Tasmania's Mount Anne

image.altText: CFMEu sign Brisbane

props.synopsis: A probe into the CFMEU has begun in Brisbane, examining allegations of bullying, violence and misogyny at the powerful construction union.

title.children: First witness in CFMEU inquiry says bosses 'revelled' in being feared

image.altText: Parent Luke Driscoll stands holding his daughter outside of his home in Broken Hill.

props.synopsis: One of the few childcare operators in Broken Hill has closed its doors indefinitely with 24 hours warning after entering voluntary administration.

title.children: Parents in 'childcare desert' scrambling as operator goes into administration

image.altText: A large crowd of people holding signs while marching in front of Queensland parliament.

props.synopsis: The union has confirmed it will go ahead with protected industrial action on November 25, with teachers to walk off the job for a day.

title.children: Queensland teachers to strike for second time amid pay dispute

image.altText: a teddy bear and flower sit outside an apartment complex

props.synopsis: The 48-year-old man pleaded guilty to murdering his three-year-old son in a unit in Sydney's south-west two years ago.

title.children: 'I'll probably get 30 years': Father admits to murdering toddler son

image.altText: An old lady walks down a street with buildings damaged by military strikes behind her.

props.synopsis: Recently released video shows a "Mad Max-style" convoy entering Pokrovsk in Ukraine's east on motorcycles and in ramshackle cars, in what experts say is part of Russia's latest push to take the city.

title.children: Russian troops advance in 'Mad Max-style' convoy, desperate to take strategic Ukrainian city
